qas.question: Who created the costumes for Queen's 1975 tour?
What country did Queen play in for the first time in 1975?
Queen had a bitter split with what management company in 1975?
What manager of Led Zeppelin tried to sign Queen?
Whom did Queen eventually sign with after rejecting the Swan Song records contract?

context: In 1975, the band left for a world tour with each member in <a0_0>Zandra Rhodes<a0_0/>-created costumes and accompanied with banks of lights and effects. They toured the US as headliners, and played in <a1_0>Canada<a1_0/> for the first time. In September, after an acromonious split with Trident, the band negotiated themselves out of their <a2_0>Trident Studios<a2_0/> contract and searched for new management. One of the options they considered was an offer from Led Zeppelin's manager, <a3_0>Peter Grant<a3_0/>. Grant wanted them to sign with Led Zeppelin's own production company, Swan Song Records. The band found the contract unacceptable and instead contacted Elton John's manager, <a4_0>John Reid<a4_0/>, who accepted the position.
